Description: Hollow terracotta figure of Bes standing, his hands on his thighs, on a flat-faced plinth. He wears a high feathered crown, and his tail is shown hanging between his legs. Summary details, mainly the buttocks, at the back; circular vent. Surface much worn. Two-piece mould. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt, with a brown surface. Traces of a white dressing on front, mainly on the crown.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased. Probably Ptolemaic. Comparanda. Near: Breccia 1934: no. 187; Hilton Price 1897: 395, no. 3275, from Bubastis; Hodjash 2004: 103, no. 7s, dated Roman period. Bibliog. Fischer 1994: 256, no. 546.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3086)
